text: I would like the editor to use 4 space tabs instead of 2..
a whole debate/arguement could break out, but I like 2 spaces better personally. I could settle for 3 seems like a fair middleground
Shawn, it’d help your support teams when they go in and look at people’s code to troubleshoot things, it’d look clean and not rediculously inconsistently indented

hate to be THAT guy today, but can someone at HS add a site to the DM2 beta for me? (I submitted the request form yesterday around mid-day) I have a junior developer that I want to build something out the proper way and the new custom module editor solves a particular problem for them.
Send the message to <@U87NGNETZ> - He'll take care of you
Sorry Jon, we are short handed right now. Alex who usually does the ungating selfishly took a vacation this week. What is the ID?

He deserves a vacation - if he’s been working on DM2 looks like a lot of hard work was put into it - ID is 123881

I owe ya some bug reports :beetle: or a :beer:
Should be good to go, please have a quick look and confirm if you dont mind…
:white_check_mark: Thank you I appreciate it, again I’m sorry for being a nag
Nope, def. not a nag. We are here for you!
Agree with Shawn here, appreciate everyone bearing with us this week. If you have any accounts that urgently need it, reach out to one of us.

So im just going to put it out there, and if I offend anyone, please know I dont mean to but I noticed in the modules marketplace there are two new approved modules of "Site Search Results" and "Site Search Input" the feat image and descriptions are all really bare bones and provide no details. I am curious to the level of details required and the QA on the side of HS for these submissions. I know you can't submit a module that is similar to another but I feel like submission like the ones that are currently provide no value to the end user looking at the module for use on their site and look more like a quick placeholder for users looking to update it later so they can gain an advantage on getting that "we had it first" spot. Again no offense to the publisher, I havent looked at it or anything like that, just offering a developer opinion on what I am seeing.
I think those are modules created by HubSpot that haven’t been rolled out to everyone yet. <@U22PWJ41G>
